parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "LSF",
  "details": {
    "queue": "gpuv100",
    "gpu_mode": "exclusive_process",
    "job_name": "AL_Fremstillingsform_6",
    "cores": 4,
    "memory_per_core": "12GB",
    "walltime": "24:00",
    "modules": [
      "python3/3.9.14",
      "cudnn/v8.3.0.98-prod-cuda-11.5"
    ],
    "virtual_environment": "./venv",
    "script": "run_BERT_AL.py",
    "script_arguments": {
      "target_col": "Fremstillingsform",
      "cv": 6,
      "acq_function": "entropy"
    }
  }
}
```

This script uses the LSF (Load Sharing Facility) batch system. It requests a GPU queue with one exclusive GPU, specifies the job name, number of cores, memory requirements, and wall time limit. It also loads specific Python, CUDA, and cuDNN modules. It activates a virtual environment and runs a Python script called `run_BERT_AL.py` with specified arguments.
